summary:
I am a recent graduate at The Hague University in the Netherlands with a bachelor degree of European Studies specialized in Communication Management. As part of the requirements for this course, I completed my internship at a Dutch software company, Human Inference Enterprise B.V for a period of 5 months. This internship provided me an insight into ICT, marketing, internal communication and project management. 

My academic program at The Hague University has prepared me well to be professional communicator through a wide variety of communication courses such as Marketing Communication, International Corporate Communication. Due to my personal interest, I also participated in elective courses like International Marketing and Events Organization. On top of these, my research, analytical, presentation skills have well-developed by acting as a marketing communication consultants throughout the intensive projects, of which also enable me to handle pressure more easily.

Being originated in Hong Kong and have been studying and working in Australia and the Netherlands for the past 3 years, I am familiar with and confident in working with people coming from diverse backgrounds. Besides being native in Cantonese, my overseas experience has concreted my foreign language skills in English, Mandarin, German and Dutch. 

I am eager to develop my career as a communication specialist with the focus on events organizing. This is what I am passionate for, as I enjoy interpersonal interaction.

Specialties: I have participated in different projects during my study program at the Hague University, which acknowledged me with aspects such as brand positioning, marketing, events organizing, corporate communication (CSR) etc.

school.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

education.field_of_study: Economics, Mass Communication, Advance Writing, Law

education.degree_name: Hong Kong Advance Level of Education
education.field_of_study: Accounting, Economics, Business Management, English, Chinese
